subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: How the Beatles Brought Hinduism to the West
description: A 60-second lesson on How the Beatles Brought Hinduism to the West.

hook.text: In 1968, the world's biggest band went to India. They came back with meditation, mantras, and a new kind of music.

buildup.text: The Beatles studied with Maharishi Mahesh Yogi in Rishikesh. Transcendental Meditation went from obscure to mainstream.

discovery.text: George Harrison's 'My Sweet Lord' put Hindu chanting on pop radio. Millions heard 'Hare Krishna' for the first time.

twist.text: The 1960s counterculture embraced Eastern religion as rebellion against Western materialism. Spirituality became cool.

climax.text: The Beatles didn't just change music. They opened a door between East and West that has never closed since.

punchline.text: Four musicians opened the West to Hindu thought. The door never closed.

quiz.question: How did the Beatles influence Western spirituality?
options: They popularized meditation and Hindu ideas through music and celebrity
